body:
Hum, there might be an issues with sqlite. it seem to use an in-memory sqlite3 database, so it is not a file corruption...

There does not seem to be any logging in the part of the code. Nor configurable.

Is sqlite3 lib/python package  up to date ?
Are you running from master of 2.1 ? 

You can try to hop on the help chat : http://www.hipchat.com/ghSp7E1uY to see if someone can help you live debug. If nobody's there try dev room: https://www.hipchat.com/ghtNzvmfC.

Hi, Carreau,
        Thanks a lot for your help. The version of ipython is 2.1. the version of sqlite3 is 3.6.20.

Python3 guru ( @takluyver ) do you thing we should set the `text_factory` to `str` ? there is probably something setting the kernel_id as whatever encoding and getting it as UTF-8 (as the decoding part is implicit on sqlite3) ?

The problem of encoding is that originally set to ASCII, but i changed it to UTF-8 manually.  I use python 2.7. I just set the default encoding from ascii to UTF8 in the python2.7/site-packages/sitecustomize.py, but it still not works
How did you set the encoding ?

I think that column should be a UUID stored as hex digits, in which case it should be valid ascii, valid UTF-8, and valid most-encodings-you-would-ever-use. Changing the text_factory seems like a sticking plaster fix - if it can't decode that field as UTF-8, then something else is wrong by that point.
@forwardcjj Do you have any configuration? Does this happen when you try to open your first notebook, or later? Can you post the _complete_ output of the server log up to the traceback?

Hi, all, sorry for the late reply. My network just went down. Here is the complete output: 

I just set the default encoding from ascii to UTF8 in the python2.7/site-packages/sitecustomize.py, but it still not works.

Are you using IPython master, or 2.1? What do you get from:

```
python -c 'import IPython; print(IPython.sys_info())'
```

?
This is the first time I created the notebook. When I wrote some codes and run them, it appears such errors

{'commit_hash': '681fd77',
 'commit_source': 'installation',
 'default_encoding': 'UTF-8',
 'ipython_path': '/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/IPython',
 'ipython_version': '2.1.0',

 'sys_platform': 'linux2',
 'sys_version': '2.7.6 (default, Jul  8 2014, 00:44:03) \n[GCC 4.4.7 20120313 (Red Hat 4.4.7-4)]'}

This is a weird error - we've never seen anything like that before, and we can't come up with any scenario that should lead to invalid UTF-8 in that field.

You mentioned that you've changed the default encoding - have you customised anything else that might affect this?
no, I only changed the default coding in the python2.7/site-packages/sitecustomize.py,  I did not change anything else.
I used to uninstall the ipython and reinstall again. It was still not working
If you don't change sitecustomize (i.e. let the default encoding be ascii), does it still fail?
it will appear the ascii error instead of UTF-8
Weird. Is it easy to try it with Python 3?
I have only python 2.7 on my centos.

I had exactly the same problem.
After rebuilding sqlite3, python and ipython it started working.
My problem was, that sqlite3 was already build somewhere on the machine, but not linked properly. The installation of sqlite3 found _sqlite3.so and didn't build it again, so I was missing it in my installation.
So I linked it first properly adding it to pythonpath and than rebuilt python and ipython and thats about it.

@vrujbr I have the same problem. Can you please elaborate on your fix? 
Another complicating factor for me is that I have [Python 2.6 and 2.7 installed](https://github.com/h2oai/h2o/wiki/Installing-python-2.7-on-centos-6.3.-Follow-this-sequence-exactly-for-centos-machine-only), since CentOS requires 2.6 for yum

``` sh

$ sqlite3 -version
3.6.20


$ python -V
Python 2.7.6

```

Closing as this issue is not in IPython itself and if still problematic and relevant should be opened on the right repository.  This will allow to keep the number of opened issue on the IPython repo under control. 

Feel free to keep commenting or reopen if necessary.

Thanks.
